attributes.action: Require complete financial transparency as to where the Treasury spent the £21,700,396.00 it retained from speed camera fines for the financial year 2003/2004 and further call for complete transparency in the future.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Following Department of Transport reports -- The amount retained by the Treasury out of a total £113,549,240 was £21,700,396.00-that is to say almost 22 Million pounds in the 2003/04 financial year.(Ofiicial DoT figures). 
We, the taxpayers, would like to know EXACTLY where this £22 Million went and call for complete, honest accounts-of every single part of speed and parking fine revenues henceforth with IMMEDIATE effect.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
